availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert G. Potter (Clay County, Kentucky, captain)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier. Clay County, Kentucky native. Son of Barton Potter and Elizabeth A. Potter. Married to Nancy Gilbert Potter on October 17, 1865. Merchant in Clay County in 1860. Served in the Twenty-Fourth Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) from July 31, 1862 to July 21, 1864. Served in the Twenty-Fourth Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain from December 30,1862 to July 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clay County Marriages, Film #001904623, p. 678.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Manchester, p. 1.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Precinct 1, p. 171A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Manchester, p. 467B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0370.
